title: Fix ur shit Riot
body:
This Vi went 3/15 in my game. She asked everyone in the enemy team to come to a lane where she'd happily give them the free kill and later she'd claim to be lagging. She'd even show her 35 ms ping just to taunt the team. Reported her and nothing has happened and I'm pretty sure something must happen in 15 minutes or nothing will. Great job riot 0/10 for service

*name removed*

All she bought was boots the entire game

replies.body:
> I'm pretty sure something must happen in 15 minutes or nothing will.

That seems to be a bit of a misinterpretation of the system.

*Ideally*, something should happen within 15 minutes of the end of the match, though keep in mind that's general for chat-related offences which are much easier than gameplay offences to review. The thing is, Riot's systems aren't exactly ideal when it comes to gameplay offences, and it can often take longer than is ideal for something to actually happen.

It's also important to note that the boards has a "no name and shame" policy which means use of summoner names is prohibited. I'd recommend removing the name, but if you don't it will be done by the mods sooner or later.

Having skimmed through the match history of the player in question, it seems like this is either a recent trend within their behaviour (specifically, their K/D/A ratios being skewed towards dying), but the "trolling" aspect of it (stuff like spamming daggers for items) doesn't actually seem to exist outside of the one game (only skimmed through past month or so of their matches). It's possible it was a one-off situation where the player had just snapped, or possibly even had someone else on the account. That's not to say the behaviour is acceptable, it just isn't, however it doesn't seem to be consistent, either.

So to your logic, If i play the majority of my games fairly like the rest of the community i can have a few 'free' games where I'm allowed to int and grief just as long as it isn't in the chat. Not only that but it's been 8 long years that Riot has been running this god-forsaken game and they're still unable to tackle players who int? Pft complete and utterly pathetic

That's not what I'm saying.

What I'm saying is that, based on the information I, *as a player*, have access too, there is very little to support that this case of trolling/griefing is consistent across games. It seems fairly obvious that, in the game in question, it's almost definitely a case of trolling/griefing, however the information that Riots people would be working with is far greater and may take some time for the case to actually get through the system and be properly reviewed. Generally, they want to be sure they're actually getting the right people, hence why it takes longer than it probably should for a lot of those kinds of players to receive punishment, and with little or no consistency of the behaviour within their history, it makes it harder to determine how necessary the punishment is (given it's basically a straight escalation to 14-day ban for gameplay offences, as I understand).

It's not that Riot is simply incapable of tackling these kinds of players, but the fact remains that gameplay offences are a lot harder to pin down and review, it's not as simple as reading a few lines of chat (which is something that *can* be done relatively efficiently using an automated system) and so requires plenty of manual input. If you took a look at other games, you might notice that a fair few of them struggle with dealing with such players, not (necessarily) because of any innate fault within their systems, but because of the difficulty of tackling that kind of behaviour.
I looked at that match history, and it does look like that player was inting. Hopefully you reported the player for intentional feeding.
